question: What is the maximum home loan I can get with an annual income of $80,000 and a debt of $500 per month?
true_answer: Based on your income and debts, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can get with an annual income of $80,000 and a debt of $500 per month?
Plan: 1) Calculate debt-to-income ratio using calculator. 2) Retrieve max loan amount guidelines. 3) Verify with home_loan_agent. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio with monthly income $6666.67 and debt $500.
Retrieving knowledge on maximum home loan amounts based on DTI.
Guidelines suggest maximum DTI of 36% allows larger loan amounts.
Calculating maximum loan amount based on DTI 36% and monthly income.
Does the estimate consider any interest rates?
Retrieving information on typical interest rates for home loans.
Current average interest rate considered is 3.5% over 30 years.
Review complete. Calculation and guidelines align.
Based on your income and debts, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000.
